info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 10:20AM CDT until April 7 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
Current River at Van Buren affecting Carter County.
Current River near Doniphan affecting Ripley County.
.A multi-day heavy rain is headed toward the region lasting through Saturday. Three days of rainfall is incorporated into the forecast but it still does not include the entire event. The Current River will start to rise tomorrow and increases in crest forecasts can be expected. Now is the time to prepare for flooding.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Current River at Van Buren.
* WHEN...From late Saturday night to Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 21.5 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING
